intro: Hannoa klaineana, commonly known as the golden bell heath, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy, bell-shaped yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to coastal and mountainous regions. It is a low-growing shrub that produces small, leathery leaves and is often found in fynbos vegetation. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
